001package src.pkg_commands;
002import src.pkg_models.Player;
003import src.pkg_game.GameEngine;
004
005
006/**
007 * FixCommand class is a command that allows the player to fix a bug if he finds his PC.
008 * This class allows the player to win the game.
009 * 
010 * @author Pierre MATAR
011 */
012public class FixCommand extends Command
013{
014     /**
015     * Executes the "fix" command for the player.
016     * It checks if the player has the correct item (the PC) and if the second word
017     * of the command is "bug". If the conditions are met, the player wins the game.
018     *
019     * @param pPlayer the player who issued the command
020     * @param pGameEngine the game engine that controls the game state
021     */
022    
023    @Override
024    public void execute(final Player pPlayer, final GameEngine pGameEngine ) {
025        if (pPlayer.getItem(pGameEngine.getThePC().getName()) == null) pGameEngine.getGui().println("You didn't find yourPC yet ...");
026        else if (pPlayer.getItem(pGameEngine.getThePC().getName()) != null && (!super.hasSecondWord() || !super.getSecondWord().equals("bug"))) pGameEngine.getGui().println("ahh you were close !");
027        else {
028            pGameEngine.getGui().println("------------ YOUUUUUPIII you have fixed the bug, you won the Game BRAVO ! ------------");
029            QuitCommand vQuitCommand = new QuitCommand();
030            vQuitCommand.setState(true);
031            vQuitCommand.execute(pPlayer, pGameEngine);
032        }
033        
034        
035        
036    }
037}
